```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(knitr) # for kable()

raw_data <- rio::import("../data/raw/census-base-anonymized-2020.xlsx")

```

## Overview of the dataset

The dataset consists of `r dim(raw_data)[1]` observations (rows) and `r dim(raw_data)[2]` columns. Each column is a question. We will have to think how to handles all the columns that are a coding language.  

The count of NAs by column:

```{r overview}

# glimpse(raw_data)

raw_data %>%
  select(everything()) %>%  # replace to your needs
  summarise_all(list(~ sum(is.na(.)))) %>%
  t() %>%
  kable(format = "html")

```
